abstract: Intersection, company behind project to transform phone booths across New York City into Wi-Fi kiosks, has opted to simply replace four remaining old-style sidewalk phone booths on West End Ave on Upper West Side with new landline booths, rather than with kiosks; decision is in part due to local preservationists working with Verizon to keep working public landlines in neighborhood.
lead_paragraph: The boxy, glass-enclosed booths that were once ubiquitous on city sidewalks are all but a memory now — except for the four that are being replaced by refurbished models.

headline.main: And Then There Were Four: Phone Booths Saved on Upper West Side Sidewalks
headline.print_headline: In Mobile Age, Preserving Stationary Relics on Upper West Side

snippet: The boxy, glass-enclosed booths that were once ubiquitous on city sidewalks are all but a memory now — except for the four that are being replaced by refurbished models.
